abstract: The co-host of the popular "All Things Considered'' program will leave the position for a year because her husband is going to work for President Obama's re-election campaign.
snippet: The co-host of the popular "All Things Considered'' program will leave the position for a year because her husband is going to work for President Obama's re-election campaign.
lead_paragraph: 12:45 p.m. | Updated | Michele Norris, the co-host of the flagship NPR news program "All Things Considered," will leave that position for a year, she said Monday, because her husband, Broderick Johnson, is joining President Obama's re-election campaign.

headline.main: Michele Norris Temporarily Leaving Position at NPR's 'All Things Considered'
